snippet: Wasn’t Europe paying attention when Lehman Brothers imploded? The response to the euro-zone crisis makes you wonder.
abstract: Joe Nocera argues that European leaders have failed to learn the lessons of the American financial crisis, which was ameliorated by massive lending from the Federal Reserve; contends that investor confidence will remain at a nadir unless the European Central Bank and other institutions abandon short-term measures and become lenders of last resort; notes that there is little political will for such a shift.
lead_paragraph: Wasn’t Europe paying attention when Lehman Brothers imploded? The response to the euro-zone crisis makes you wonder.
